page.title: 07ITEMS OF INTEREST 2
page.content: Items of Interest. Maggoty Johnson's Wood.Maggoty's Wood was named after Mr. Samuel Johnson.Samuel was a court jesyer at Gawsworth Hall which still exists. In the Hall Samuel was known as Lord Flame.Samuel is buried in Maggoty's Wood,which is why it is named after him. He came to be buried there because he said "I shall shoot an arrow up into the air and where ever it lands I shall be buried." The wood is really called Maggoty Johnson's Wood, but we call it more often Maggoty's Wood. The wood is wned and maintained by the National Trust. Written and typed by Alastair Rutter, with interference from Stefan Bond.
